New Records: Pete Alonso's homer was No. 221 for the first baseman, moving him ahead of Mike Piazza for third place on the franchise’s all-time list.
Key Match Events: Tyrone Taylor crossed the plate with the go-ahead run in the top of the ninth.
Edwin Diaz got three outs in the bottom of the inning for the save.
Jose Iglesias’ RBI single in the ninth gave the Mets their final lead.
Pete Alonso smashed a homer leading off the second to give the Mets a 1-0 lead.
Randal Grichuk blasted a two-run homer in the third that gave the D’backs a 2-1 lead.
Francisco Lindor cleared the right-field fence to tie it 2-2 in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: David Peterson commented on the resilience of the group, emphasizing the importance of moving on from each game.
Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed pride in the team's performance, especially after the previous night's loss.
